did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Aaron Cometbus Punk and Underground Press Collection, ca. 1977-2013.
did.physdesc: Flyers, printed material, posters, photographs, correspondence, and ephemera.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Flyers, posters, magazines, files, and zines relating to American punk and alternative culture collected or created by Aaron Cometbus, including his own work as a writer and musician.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Aaron Elliott, better known as Aaron Cometbus, has published Cometbus magazine since 1981. He is also an accomplished novelist, lyricist, and drummer.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Flyers, posters, magazines, files, and zines relating to American punk and alternative culture collected or created by Aaron Cometbus, including his own work as a writer and musician. The archive contains hundreds of fanzines and small magazines, plus original manuscripts and paste-ups for Cometbus and related publishing and distribution records. Board games, business cards, set lists, and venue histories provide a personal, behind-the-scenes view of punk both as music and as a movement, from 1980 to the present.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Aaron Cometbus Punk and Underground Press Collection, #8107. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Introduction to the collection written by Aaron Elliot can be found in Box 1, Folder A.

arrangement.p: The first two subseries are arranged geographically starting with locations in the Bay Area and then alphabetically by title within each location.

processinfo.p: "Creator" is used throughout Series I to denote the author, editor, or publisher of a work.

scopecontent.p: Contains double-sided "Rock Against Reagan 1983" and "World Cannabis March on the U.N." poster.

U.K. Subs, Anti-Nowhere League. Note from donor: This caused a huge laugh. Of course, hardcore was particularly and uniquely American at that point, and certainly wasn't represented by two geezer/biker UK bands, even if the two bands happened to be pretty good.

Contains: "Songs of Wrath and Optimism" by Astrid Oto, "Untitled" by Astrid Oto, "House Band Feud" by The Blank Fight, "Untitled" by Cleveland Bound Death Sentence, "Sleep, What's That? EP" by Crimpshrine, "On the Waterfront EP" by Crybaby MacArthur, "Untitled" by Pinhead Gunpowder, and "Redmond Shooting Stars" by Redmond Shooting Stars.

Contains an introduction by Aaron Cometbus and the cassette tapes: "Banned in R.C." by Blatz, "Rokken' Like Dokken'" by The Blottos, "Live at the Metropolis" by Brap Smears, "Brent's T.V." by Brent's T.V., "Through Our Eyes" by Complete Disorder, "Untitled" by Crimpshrine, "Driller Killers" by Driller Killers, "Arbgabdo Baby!" by Fleshies, "Eartraining for Corporates" by Harbinger, "JÃ¼ke @ Gilman" by JÃ¼ke, "Untitled" by Maniax, "Bloody Marysâ¦" by Premarital Sex, "It's Not Just a Bandâ¦It's a Lifestyle" by Soup, and "Pug's Not Dead" by Zombie Dogs. Also contains the compilation tapes "Gimme Cooties," "Absolutely Zippo Presents...'Time Capsule'," "Every Dog Has its Blues: The Bands of Lucky Dog," and "We Got Glue."

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by letter date or post-marked envelope date where available.
